basics.name: Gary Roumanis
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a perpetual learner and passionate engineer with an eye for detail. I love solving problems regardless of the domain.

work.summary: Currently working on the Dart language team helping to build infrastructure and tools with an emphasis towards web development. Previously I was the tech lead for the DoubleClick Search frontend infrastructure. Core technologies include Angular, GWT, Bazel, Flutter and of course Dart.
Helped develop a near real time, streaming, log processing service along with corresponding monitoring tools and dashboards. Core technologies included C#, Kafka, Zookeeper, Ember and Typescript.

Defined and managed the scope of various projects, such as Product Listings and Ads in Windowâ€™s Search Charm. Specified requirements, conducted usability studies, triaged issues and assigned them to engineering teams.

The lrslib library is a reverse search algorithm for vertex enumeration/convex hull problems. I adapted the synchronous lrslib library to take advantage of multiple processors/cores. Application was developed in C++ and made use of the free boost library. Source code available [here](http://cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~avis/C/lrs.html).
Wrote functional specifications for multiple projects including a prototype which allowed for the display of various coupon advertisements within the paid search workflow of Bing.

Designed a framework for harnessing the computing power of humans to solve Multiple Sequence Alignment problems. Application front-end was developed in Flash ActionScript 3 while the back-end used Java and MySql. Available [here](http://phylo.cs.mcgill.ca).

education.area: Joint honours in Computer Science and Mathematics

awards.title: //oneweek Company Hackathon - Winner
awards.summary: Created an [eye controlled wheelchair](https://blogs.microsoft.com/firehose/2014/07/31/oneweek-hackathon-outcome-as-individual-parts-we-were-good-together-we-were-so-much-better/). The hack consisted of four parts, Tobii eye gaze tracking for Windows, an eye gaze "Joystick" application, Kinect-based "Safe Drive" for obstacle avoidance, and a microcontroller interface to a power wheelchair.

awards.title: Intern App Competition - Runner Up
awards.summary: In two months of spare time I learned the Silverlight framework and C# to implement a fully featured Windows Phone 7 app. The app provided an internet streaming radio service, offering a simple way for people to share and discover music and playlists. The app had over 50,000 downloads and a 4.5 star rating.

awards.title: Undergraduate Research Competition - Winner
awards.summary: Received first place in the field of Mathematics and Computer Science for the work on [Phylo](http://phylo.cs.mcgill.ca) - a framework for solving Multiple Sequence Alignment problems.
